uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.apps

Class Option.Instance

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.apps.Option.Instance
  • Enclosing class:
    Option

    public class Option.Instance
extends java.lang.Object
    An Instance of an Option contains values assigned to an option. Objects of this class make sure they adhere to constraints applied to their related Option.
     

    • Constructor Summary

      Option.Instance()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Option.Instance

        public Option.Instance()

    • Method Detail

      • addValue

        public Option.Instance addValue(java.lang.String argument)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a value to this option instance. If the option's value separator is set and this option takes multiple argument, the argument will be separated into one or more values using the value separator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the value cannot be added to the option because the option cannot take more values or because the option doesn't take values at all
        Parameters:
        argument - The value or values to assign to this option instance
        Returns:
        This option instance

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The identity of the option this object is an instance of
        See Also:
        Option.getId()

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Returns the value of an option if it has one, or null if none have been set. If this option takes multiple values, the first value is returned.
        Returns:
        This option's value or null if none was set or this option does not take values

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(int index)
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the nth value of an option where n is set by the variable index. If this option has no values, null is returned. The first value is at index=0
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If this option instance takes values but there is as many as index of them.
        Parameters:
        index - The number of the value to return
        Returns:
        This option's value or null if this option does not take values

      • getValues

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getValues()
        Returns:
        All values this option instance has, or null if this option instance does not take values

      • hasNoValues

        public boolean hasNoValues()
        Returns:
        true if no values have been set in this option instance. false otherwise.
